Posts.Content: Hi out there is anyone else going through the awful week of waiting to find out their results after biopsies for breast cancer? I am trying very hard not to keep dwelling on it but it is hard!  Radiographer seemed pretty convinced it was a carcinoma so am prepared for the worst. Family have been amazing but they have to get on with their own lives!
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed invasive ductal carcinoma.

Posts.Content: Thank you -it is great to know that others are going through the purgatory! Have had some wine with my dearest friend and it has helped but no doubt at five tomorrow morning the demons will be back!
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed invasive ductal carcinoma.

Posts.Content: Thank you for that Tracey! I will let you know how it goes.  Not sure how much I will sleep tonight but have to try!    Trish x
Posts.Title: Good Luck Trishell

Posts.Content: Meant to say good luck with your oncologist appointment. Most people on here seem to find they feel a bit better once things start happening, so I hope you find the same.  Will be keeping my fingers crossed for you anyway!   Trish xx
Posts.Title: Good Luck Trishell

Posts.Content: Hi bushy i am going for biopsy results tomorrow after an agonising week of waiting! It really is the pits but after the ultrasound last week the radiographer seemed fairly certain that it was a carcinoma so won't be surprised if that is the outcome! Just want to know what the plan is.  I hope you get some get some good news tomorrow and at least the waiting will be nearly over - good luck
Posts.Title: A good cry

Posts.Content: And to you too bushy! Let's hope we both get something positive tomorrow even if it just to give us a plan to deal with! Xx
Posts.Title: A good cry

Posts.Content: Hi Bushy Sounds like we are both in much the same boat.  There was some debate on my 'team' apparently as to whether I should have chemo first to shrink everything and then do the surgery, but I have a small bust and the lump is right behind the nipple which they would have to take anyway, so couldn't see any reason not to just get on with the mastectomy.  Although I haven't had the lymph node results yet, the radiographer seemed to think they would be affected as well, so they will be doing an axillary clearance at the same time.  Now that it is sinking in, I just want to get on with it and start the journey to recovery!  You don't need to feel sorry for upsetting your family - you didn't do this on purpose, and you may well be surprised at how well they deal with it.  My daughters were amazingly supportive when I told them, and I'm sure your sons will be the same.  Get another bottle of that red wine out, and have a glass or two!  I am on my second glass this evening! Big hugs Trishell xx
Posts.Title: A good cry

Posts.Content: Hi Bushy am going today for bone scan then tomorrow for pre op admission thing!  I think by the time it gets to Monday I will be climbing the walls, but I went shopping with my good friend last Monday which helps to pass the time.  Have ordered lots of audiobooks for my iPod as they help to take your mind off things when trying to get to sleep.  Hope meeting with oncologist goes ok - I'm told it helps to talk to the experts. Will be thinking of you on Monday!   trishell x
Posts.Title: A good cry

Posts.Content: Hi Bushy How are you doing today?  Do you know when you can start your treatment?  I am telling myself that I will start to feel better once the treatment is under way, as that is what everyone says.  The waiting seems to go on forever, doesn't it! Trishell x
Posts.Title: A good cry

Posts.Content: Hi Bushy The BC nurse told me that as expected the nodes were infected, so the surgeon will be doing an axillary clearance which I think means they will take the dodgy nodes away.  I had already realised that, so it wasn't a shock. Most people seem to have nodes taken out.   Someone on here told me that the ct scan is to check that you are ok for surgery, and obviously they check everything else at the same time.  The whole thing is a bit of a nightmare, but the sooner we start, then the sooner we finish!  I have been talking to close friends, plus some other people I had to contact to change appointments etc and without exception, everyone has been very supportive.  And it is also amazing how many people have said they have relatives and close friends who have been throughor are going through  the same thing, so I feel more positive after talking to them.  I have two daughters, three grandsons and a ginger cat, who adopted us when we moved here ten years ago! Hugs Trishell x
Posts.Title: A good cry

Posts.Content: Well my elder daughter is approaching 40 so you are young to me! I am coming up to 69. I have two daughters and three little grandsons - they seem to have lost the recipe for girls - but this is a tough thing at any age.  Breast cancer now is dealt with so much more effectively than it was even ten years ago and I think we can feel very positive about it.  I just wonder if we could persuade the NHS to fund some bottles of Sauvignon and Merlot ?    Trishell x
Posts.Title: A good cry

Posts.Content: Ps well done on the wig purchase! Having been thinking along those lines myself
Posts.Title: A good cry

Posts.Content: Hi bushy i hope you get some good news tomorrow. To be honest the radiographer had prepared me for the worst so I wasn't surprised today.  I now am just waiting for the node results which he wasn't optimistic about.  Just hope the ct scan tomorrow doesn't throw up any more nasties! The not sleeping is a bit of a horror isn't it!   I am really hoping for a decent night tonight - may have a glass of Sauvignon to help!  Anyway good luck for tomorrow and let us know how you get on. Xx
Posts.Title: A good cry

Posts.Content: Hi Bushy How are you today, now that it has sunk in a bit more?  I hope you managed to talk to your parents and your boys - they will give you plenty of support I'm sure, and it really does help. Trishell xx
Posts.Title: A good cry

Posts.Content: Well, I think I am a bit older than you so have quite a lot of contacts/ friends who have been through what we are going through.  Everyone is very positive and I am heartened by the responses from friends/ relatives when I tell them.  The outlook is good now from years ago and we are going to get through this , bushy.  I have just been round to my neighbour/ great friend who has bought me some lovely 'getting you through' gifts - makes you feel a lot better!  Many glasses of Sauvignon help as well, but we will get there! hugs trishell
Posts.Title: A good cry

Posts.Content: Hi everyone   just back from getting biopsy results and it seems I have grade 2 invasive carcinoma with ductal and lobular features.  I need a mastectomy which is to be on March 9.  Going for ct scan tomorrow so although I feel better for having a plan, still fretting about the lymph node results which are not back yet! Surgeon was lovely and she realised I was on the point of meltdown so got me in for the op a bit sooner!  How did you get on bushy?
Posts.Title: A good cry

Posts.Content: Hi Bushy just wanted to wish you good luck today - will be thinking of you!
Posts.Title: A good cry

Posts.Content: Hi Dorothy you will find this site a great support when you need a bit of information or tips for what helps during chemo, as well as cheering you up when you are feeling down! We all get days when we need a bit of comfort and it helps such a lot to know you are not on your own. Hope your treatment goes as well as possible, but don't be afraid to ask questions on here as there is usually someone who has been there, done that and got the t shirt!  Oh, and we have our own wonderful comic who keeps us entertained with some great jokes! good luck xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Lee i have had a picc line in since I started and I haven't had any trouble at all with it.  It is definitely easier for having the chemo and taking blood etc. Regarding the Herceptin, I will be having that but by injection, so picc line not used for that.  Hope that helps.   Xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi bunnies Nadjie and Karin, hope it goes ok for you both tomorrow. I will hopefully be right behind you on Thursday, and am hoping this time round will be better than last.  Mags, good to hear your Mum is doing well.  I guess she finds that being busy helps her to deal with everything that is happening to her at the moment.  Big hug from me! xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi June bunnies I am due for 3rd FEC on Thursday, hoping bloods etc will all be ok! So next week some of us will be halfway and some others more than that.  Won't be sorry to see the back of feckin FEC!  Nadjie, how are you doing? Are you on third FEC on Wednesday? Karin, good to see some more jokes from you, you must be feeling more upbeat.  I have found it quite hard this time to raise the spirits, so your jokes are always welcome! love n hugs to all the bunnies xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Karin so pleased to hear it went well for you today after all your fretting! Thanks for posting such a great long detailed post, it really helps us bunnies coming along behind you.  You might not get all those symptoms,  and it might be kinder than you are expecting.   Fingers crossed anyway hon!  love n hugs xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Good luck for tomorrow. Brenda - I hope it all goes well for you. We will all be thinking of you and sending you our love xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi bunnies Had FEC 3 today with the cold cap, and feeling well enough to eat some Lancashire hot pot made for us by my lovely neighbour.  Karin, it's good to hear that Mr T is treating you well so far - hope that continues for you.  And Mags, great to hear your mum is coping so well. She must be a strong lady!  Hope she continues to do well.  Nadjie, how are you feeling today - I think you had your third FEC yesterday? And your bike ride obviously didn't affect your counts, so that is amazing! Another strong woman! Hope everyone who has had treatment this week is doing ok, and continues that way. love n hugs to all the bunnies xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Morning bunnies hope everyone is feeling a bit better this morning regarding fuzzy heads, fatigue and various aches and pains.  I am on day 3 post FEC 3 and so far not too bad.  Expect the fatigue will kick in some time today as didn't sleep for long last night, probably the steroids, but that was my last FEC so at least the next T will be different ....... Nadjie, good to hear you are doing well, you are a day ahead of me so I am cheered by your progress! You seem to handle all this so well.  Mags, hope you managed to contact the young woman who is in the same situation as you are - that would be so good for you both. Also hope your Mum is doing well.  Karin hope the head is beginning to clear, and Chrissie, hope fatigue is easing.  To all bunnies getting over last week's treatment, hang in there, we are getting there! love n hugs xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Nadjie good to hear you are feeling better today - hope I can say the same tomorrow! Have found this one harder on the fatigue front.  Well done on raising such an incredible amount - you are really amazing, and I take my hat off to you!  Xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Bunnies Karin, it is so good to hear that FEC 3 was better than 2 as I have struggled a bit this time.  Not so much physically, more mentally, but I had a lovely day yesterday with my family which has cheered me up! Amanda, thanks for the update on the honey.  I have been having it on toast every morning, and have not had any ulcers so far. Chrissie, hope you have a good day today, and that it all goes well tomorow. Nadjie, hope you find Wednesday ok as well.  Good luck to all the bunnies this week, hope it will be a good one! Xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Hevbo so so pleased for you that you have finished your chemo! I can only imagine what a relief it was to lift that cap off for the last time - you have done amazingly well!  Love xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Yes indeed Nadjie! You are obviously a very sporty family but that is quite an achievement for your daughter! Well done to her! I know what you all mean about the important things in life - as the Americans say 'don't sweat the small stuff' and they are right. family and good friends are what really matter, and we have all found virtual good friends on this site as well, who keep us going when we get down. Karin, loved the jokes as ever! George, thank you for your tireless support and invaluable info - you are so much appreciated! Mags and Regina - hope all is well with you.  Just had a lovely walk in a nearby country park, and hoping for a win from Murray this pm, so feeling positive about things! love to all the bunnies xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi bunnies counts all ok so all systems go for tomorrow! Mags, didn't know it was your birthday Happy Birthday! Mine is later this month, so I will be celebrating it in November! Love the jokes Karin, keep em coming. Good to hear you are not feeling too bad so far - hope that continues. Hevbojangles, how are you finding the FEC? And how is your hair? You are nearly there now, so hope all the cold cap business has been worth it! Nadjie, hope it went ok for you today. love n hugs to all the bunnies, and hope you are all having a not too bad time of it xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Bunnies Definitely the week for meltdowns and wet shoulders this week!  I had a real wobble last night, am guessing it is because a few of us are approaching the half way stage and it is all getting on top of us.  Good to hear from the gals who are beyond the halfway, and can give us some positives to concentrate on.  Karin, hope you are continuing to feel better after the first T, and have got your appetite back again after the cotton wool mouth!  All those doughnut pictures don't really do it for me I'm afraid, as I am not a great doughnut fan but if they are making anyone's taste buds work then that is a good thing!  Mags, how is your mum doing?  Hope she is making good progress!  Nadjie, how are you doing today?  Did you manage to get out on your bike?  Hevbo, you must be approaching the finish line soon - is it just one more you have?  To all the bunnies out there going through it, love n hugs, and we will get there! xxxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi bunnies day 10 after FEC 3 and feeling quite a bit better. Had lovely meal at my neighbours last night which was great so hoping I am on the up now till the next one! Nadjie, hope you have a great weekend in Liverpool with your friends and enjoy your shopping trip.  Mags, i am also having an ecg at the end of this month before starting Herceptin - is that what your mum is having? I hope she is continuing to do well.  Hope we hear from Kazza soon!  To all the bunnies, hope everyone has a nice weekend xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Leen you have had a rough time, you poor thing! Hope things start to improve for you from now on! Regarding the injections, I was shown how to do them and since then having been doing them myself which makes life a bit easier.  It's not difficult if you are ok with injections as it is a very slim needle. I noticed after the first five that I had a bit of back pain which they said was the bone marrow doing its job. Didn't get much the second time. hope you feel better soon xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Kazza great to have you back with us again and sorry to hear about your infection problems, but you are sounding like your old self, which is really good!  As you can tell, we all really missed you! love xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Happy Anniversary, Karin! And Happy Fathers Day to all the dads/ hubbies supporting us bunnies through this - we know it's tough for you! Don't know when summer is due to start, but surely it must be soon! Chrissie, maybe Mr T will be a bit easier than FEC? At least it will be shorter.  Love n hugs xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Karin i am having first T on July 2nd and first Herceptin the next day, and I also have to hang around for 6 hours to make sure no side effects.  After that the Herceptin jabs are at the same time as the T.  Have to have ECG on the Tuesday before, so I will be spending quite a bit of time tooing and froing that week! It is really good to know that it might be better than the feckin FEC - not sorry to see the back of that! Loved the jokes - you are quite a comic, and it cheers us all up so much! love n hugs Trish
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi bunnies Hope everyone is doing ok, and that those of use due to start T this week manage to get through it all right! I have a busy week, onco on Monday, ECG for Herceptin on Tuesday, T on Thursday if counts ok then first Herceptin on Friday! Shall be very relieved to get to Saturday!! Nadjie, glad to hear you had a good trip to Liverpool, hope all goes well on Wednesday for you. Karin, hope your second T will be better than the first - just think, only one more after that! xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Nadjie good luck for tomorrow with first T - I am hoping to have my first one on Thursday, providing bloods were ok today.  I also hope you manage your bike ride on Saturday - you really are amazing!  I know what you mean though about it helping to make you feel more positive about getting through the treatment, and whatever helps must be a good thing.  Anyway, take care not to overdo it, but I wish you the best of luck! xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: I couldn't agree more! The lovely people on here are so supportive and it makes such a difference when you are feeling a bit low waiting for results.  Thank you all so much!
Posts.Title: This is the best BC forum!

Posts.Content: Hi there The only thing that hes me to get to sleep is my iPod! I have loads of books and plays and podcasts on it and I find it really helps to have a virtual person reading me to sleep! You can buy lots of second hand audiobooks, and there are lots of dramas on bbc which you can download as podcasts.  Best to stick to fairly light undemanding stuff though, as you will probably sleep through quite a bit of it!
Posts.Title: Chemo Survival Kit – Version 3 – 8 April 2015 - please read and contribute...
